history.content:
I took CS61C and CS170 together right after the 61A/B/70 courses, and despite not liking many parts of 61C, felt that it was a good combination from an educational standpoint.

Both courses approach the problem of writing efficient, quick code, from different standpoints; 61C teaches you how to write code that will run quickly on most machines (and how to write code that can run in parallel on many machines), and takes you on a journey inside the machinery; on the other hand, 170 teaches you how to design efficient algorithms to solve problems. 

For this reason, while the workload of these two combined can be pretty intense, I would encourage you to start out with these two classes (along with another class, if you like; for context, I took Math 53 along with these two, and loved the semester overall)

(Also, 61C and 170 both cover key concepts in software interviews, so it might be worthwhile from an internship/career perspective too. I've also heard good things about starting with a 170/188 combination, so you might want to look into that)

I took CS61C and CS170 together right after the 61A/B/70 courses, and despite not liking many parts of 61C, felt that it was a good combination from an educational standpoint.

Both courses approach the problem of writing efficient, quick code, from different standpoints; 61C teaches you how to write code that will run quickly on most machines (and how to write code that can run in parallel on many machines), and takes you on a journey inside the machinery; on the other hand, 170 teaches you how to design efficient algorithms to solve problems. 

For this reason, while the workload of these two combined can be pretty intense, I would encourage you to start out with these two classes (along with another class, if you like; for context, I took Math 53 along with these two, and loved the semester overall)

From a policy perspective, you're required to take all lower divs before you start taking upper divs. Lots of people ignore this, but we structure them this way so you will have the best possible foundational knowledge before you start taking upper div courses.

Is it a dumb idea to start taking upper divs before taking 61c? I already took 61a and 70 and am currently in 61b and I'm trying to figure out which classes to take next fall. Also any suggestions for which upper divs to start out with?
history.subject: upper divs before 61c
